answerText: Huang Minlon modification[10] The Huang Minlon modification is a one-pot modification of this reaction, that reduces an aldehyde or ketone to an alkane.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC Los Angeles B and Iowa | 7 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: It involves heating the reactant with potassium hydroxide and hydrazine hydrate, and can improve its associated reaction.  [10] Name this modification of a reduction reaction, in which the carbonyl-containing compound is heated in an ethylene glycol solvent with the aforementioned materials.
